stimulusHtml: In an experiment, a wire with current I is placed in a uniform magnetic field of magnitude B directed to the right, as shown in the figure. The end segment of the wire has length L and is perpendicular to the magnetic field. The experiment is modified so that the direction of the magnetic field is rotated 10∘ such that a component of the field is now directed out of the page. The magnetic field is still perpendicular to the end segment. Which of the following statements correctly describes the change in the magnetic force on the end segment of the wire?
choicesHtml: The magnitude will not change, and the direction will not change.
The magnitude will decrease, and the direction will not change.
The magnitude will not change, and the direction will change by 10°.
The magnitude will decrease, and the direction will change by 10°.
The magnitude will increase, and the direction will change by 10°.
